results.title: Roald Amundsen
results.creator_credit: David Cobham, Michael Latham and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Explorers”.
Dramatization of Roald Amundsen’s victory over England’s Captrain Robert Smith in their 1911 race to the South Pole, the last terrestrial frontier. Beautifully filmed with great use of re-enactments and voice-overs. Narrated by David Attenborough.

results.title: Henry Morton Stanley
results.creator_credit: Fred Burnley, Michael Latham and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Explorers”.
This film re-enacts the journey Stanley undertook to complete Livingstone’s exploration by searching for the headwaters of the Lualaba River in central Africa. Narrated by David Attenborough. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Captain James Cook
results.creator_credit: John irvin, Michael Latham and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Explorers”.
During the years 1768-1770 Captain James Cook sailed around the world in the ‘Endeavour’ and claimed Australia for the British Crown. This is an account of his voyage. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: World of Pets
results.creator_credit: Alan Degen, Sidney Platt and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: Each program looks at a particular pet and shows how you can learn about animal behavior through the care of animals. The programs also give tips on how to look after pets.

group_works.title: Matter of taste

results.title: Matter of taste
results.creator_credit: David H. Gluck, Naomi Robin, James B. Maas, James B. Maas and David H. Gluck Productions and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human senses”.
Looks at the important role played by taste in the human body. Investigates the chemical reactions in papillae and how information is obtained and relayed to the brain and the taste identified as sweet, sour,salty or bitter.

results.title: In touch with the world
results.creator_credit: James B. Maas and David H. Gluck Productions and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human senses”.
Explains the functions of the human skin as a sense organ and the ability of the receptors to differentiate between at least five different kinds of sensations - touch, pressure, heat, cold and pain. Shows how the sense of touch has contributed to human development and adaptation of the human species to its environment.

results.title: On the nose
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human senses”.
An introduction to the sense of smell. Animation is used to illustrate the operations of the smell receptors in the nasal cavities and how this information is processed by the brain. Clearly defines the concept of smelling and recognition of odours.

group_works.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath Jr and Journal Films

results.title: Spectacular canyons
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath Jr and Journal Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Natural Phenomena Series”.
Uses diagrams and spectacular photography to introduce the geomorphological agents involved in the creation of canyons. Covers rivers, valleys and glacial valleys showing the processes of weathering and erosion. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.
results.description:
